sentences.en: " I'm so glad to see you,'said Carrie, pleased and yet nonplussed.
sentences.cn: “ 看见你我太高兴了, "嘉莉说, 既高兴又为难.

sentences.en: Cowperwood was disturbed, nonplussed at this unexpected sight.
sentences.cn: 柯帕乌一看见这种意外的情景,就感到心烦意乱, 不知所措.

sentences.en: Ed seemed nonplussed till Andy explained: " This means I'm staying the course. "
sentences.cn: 李爱德开始似乎摸不着头脑,直到马普安开始解释: “ 这就意味着我可以撑下去. ”

sentences.en: He was afraid of being treated as a provincial if he showed himself too much nonplussed.
sentences.cn: 他怕露出过于惊惶失措的样子,会叫人家把他看成乡巴佬.

sentences.en: I was completely nonplussed by his sudden appearance.
sentences.cn: 他突然出现使我大吃一惊.

sentences.en: I was nonplussed by what he asked me.
sentences.cn: 我对他的问题不知怎么回答是好.

sentences.en: It was Tigress'turn to be nonplussed.
Mrs. Clinton nonplussed, before replying, " Well, we will get along very well. "
sentences.cn: 克林顿女士顿时有些困惑, 在回应前说: “ 恩, 我们会相处的很好的. ”

sentences.en: Nixon, though no doubt nonplussed, continued to keep his thoughts to himself.
sentences.cn: 尼克松对此事无疑感到进退维谷, 然而他依然噤若寒蝉.

sentences.en: Nonplussed for a moment, Pug realized that the heavy pleasantry was intended as a kindness.
sentences.cn: 帕格一时不知所措, 而后意识到这种叫人吃不消的取笑是存心表示亲热.

sentences.en: She expected him to ask for a scotch and was rather nonplussed when he asked her to mix him a martini and lemonade.
sentences.cn: 她料想他会要一杯苏格兰威士忌，所以当他请她调一杯马提尼酒加柠檬水时，她有点不知所措。
她感到伤心 、 气愤和狼狈.
年轻光头的楞了一会儿,似乎不知怎样好了.

trans.tran_cn: 不知所措的，陷于窘境的
trans.tran_en: so surprised by something that you do not know what to say or do

trans.tran_cn: 使迷惑( nonplus的过去式和过去分词 )
